        public MapReduceObservable<org.bson.Document> mapReduce(String mapFunction,
                                                        String reduceFunction)
        Description copied from interface: MongoCollection
        Aggregates documents according to the specified map-reduce function.
        Specified by:
        mapReduce in interface MongoCollection<TDocument>
        Parameters:
        mapFunction - A JavaScript function that associates or "maps" a value with a key and emits the key and value pair.
        reduceFunction - A JavaScript function that "reduces" to a single object all the values associated with a particular key.
        Returns:
        an Observable containing the result of the map-reduce operation

      • mapReduce

        public <TResult> MapReduceObservable<TResult> mapReduce(String mapFunction,

                                                        Class<TResult> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: MongoCollection
        Aggregates documents according to the specified map-reduce function.
        Specified by:
        mapReduce in interface MongoCollection<TDocument>
        Type Parameters:
        TResult - the target document type of the iterable.
        Parameters:
        mapFunction - A JavaScript function that associates or "maps" a value with a key and emits the key and value pair.
        reduceFunction - A JavaScript function that "reduces" to a single object all the values associated with a particular key.
        clazz - the class to decode each resulting document into.
        Returns:
        an Observable containing the result of the map-reduce operation

      • insertMany

        public rx.Observable<Success> insertMany(List<? extends TDocument> documents)
        Description copied from interface: MongoCollection
        Inserts a batch of documents. The preferred way to perform bulk inserts is to use the BulkWrite API. However, when talking with a server < 2.6, using this method will be faster due to constraints in the bulk API related to error handling.
        Specified by:
        insertMany in interface MongoCollection<TDocument>
        Parameters:
        documents - the documents to insert
        Returns:
        an Observable with a single element indicating when the operation has completed or with either a com.mongodb.DuplicateKeyException or com.mongodb.MongoException

      • insertMany

        public rx.Observable<Success> insertMany(List<? extends TDocument> documents,
                                         com.mongodb.client.model.InsertManyOptions options)
        Description copied from interface: MongoCollection
        Inserts a batch of documents. The preferred way to perform bulk inserts is to use the BulkWrite API. However, when talking with a server < 2.6, using this method will be faster due to constraints in the bulk API related to error handling.
        Specified by:
        insertMany in interface MongoCollection<TDocument>
        Parameters:
        documents - the documents to insert
        options - the options to apply to the operation
        Returns:
        an Observable with a single element indicating when the operation has completed or with either a com.mongodb.DuplicateKeyException or com.mongodb.MongoException

        Description copied from interface: MongoCollection
        Removes at most one document from the collection that matches the given filter. If no documents match, the collection is not modified.
        Specified by:
        deleteOne in interface MongoCollection<TDocument>
        Parameters:
        filter - the query filter to apply the the delete operation

        an Observable with a single element the DeleteResult or with an com.mongodb.MongoException

        public rx.Observable<com.mongodb.client.result.UpdateResult> updateOne(org.bson.conversions.Bson filter,
                                                                       org.bson.conversions.Bson update)
        Description copied from interface: MongoCollection
        Update a single document in the collection according to the specified arguments.
        Specified by:
        updateOne in interface MongoCollection<TDocument>
        Parameters:
        filter - a document describing the query filter, which may not be null.
        update - a document describing the update, which may not be null. The update to apply must include only update operators.
        Returns:

        Specified by:

      • findOneAndReplace

        public rx.Observable<TDocument> findOneAndReplace(org.bson.conversions.Bson filter,
                                                  TDocument replacement)
        Description copied from interface: MongoCollection
        Atomically find a document and replace it.
        Specified by:
        findOneAndReplace in interface MongoCollection<TDocument>
        Parameters:
        filter - the query filter to apply the the replace operation
        replacement - the replacement document
        Returns:
        an Observable with a single element the document that was replaced. Depending on the value of the returnOriginal property, this will either be the document as it was before the update or as it is after the update. If no documents matched the query filter, then the observer will complete without emitting any items
